metadata.title: CVE-2017-8066 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: drivers/net/can/usb/gs_usb.c in the Linux kernel 4.9.x and 4.10.x before4.10.2 interacts incorrectly with the CONFIG_VMAP_STACK option, whichallows local users to cause a denial of service (system crash or memorycorruption) or possibly have unspecified other impact by leveraging use ofmore than one virtual page for a DMA scatterlist.

criterions.comment: linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
